Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Friendly, Affordable, Directions Important”
Reviews.Author: Bakuthecat
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, Friendly, Affordable but directions are crucial especially when you first arrive. The journey will take you at least an hour. Don't panic - just relax. It's worth it for a comfortable affordable place to stay! 1. As you come out Fiumucino Airport terminal down on the right there are a row of express buses straight to the city centre. Buy a ticket (4 euros when we went) and take the 30 minute journey to Termini (the central metro station in Rome.) 2. Enter the station and from the machine on the wall buy a one euro BIT ticket and get on the blue metro line to Rebibia. The ticket means that you can travel on public transport (bus and train) for the next 75 minutes. 3. Arrive at Rebibia. Come out the station and cross the road left 200 metres to a bank of bus stops. You will need the 444. 4. After a 5 minute journey (one major left turn on the way) you get out when the bus turns again right by a small arcade of shops. Just outside Pizza Rustica. 4. You are now a 10 to 15 minutes walk from the hotel.5. Walk back 30 metres to the main road where the bus turned off. And turn right. Walk up the long road.Eventually Pass an antiques market on the opposite side , and up to a cross roads . You now start seeing signs to the hotel. At the big cross roads take a right for 2 minutes and a right at the second petrol station (Total). The big "Hotel" sign beckons you. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “hotel not in centre of rome”
Reviews.Author: keiron r
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and presentable, room was not too bad-mini bar, heating, lcd tv(but not 1 english channel on the tv, so unless you speak itialian there's no point of watching it). We had no hot water the four days we stayed there which was quite annoying as it was -3 and snowing the whole time.Most of the staff were very helpful and friendly. Breakfast is continental and seemed to be thrown together down stairs in a make do kitchen. The hotel is not is the centre of rome and does not have any resturants around, just 'snack bars' where u can buy a slice of pizza, if you want a proper resturant meal you will have to travel into the city centre. To get to the centre of rome you have to walk 5mins to the bus stop and get a bus to the metro staion(tube) and then onwards to the centre which in all takes about an hour( make sure you buy a bus pass from a newsagents otherwise you cannot travel on the bus or metro, a 3 day tourist pass cost 11euros and you can travel any where you wish) but be sure to keep hold of your bags and wallets as there are many beggers and pickpockets on the metro and in the city

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay away from busy Rome”
Reviews.Author: UNIONJACK2010
Reviews.Content: We had a really nice and pleasent stay at Aurora Garden Hotel. The room was fine,en-suite bathroom,mini fridge and lcd tv.The only thing about TV,there was no even one chanel in english! We had to watch movies in italian,did not have a clue what were they on about! The breakfast was ok. The staff really helpful and nice!To the City Centre about 1 hour,to the Ciampino Airport about 1.45 minutes by public bus!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ulsterart
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay in this hotel. Every aspect was as all hotels should be. Everywhere was in a perfect level of decoration. Room was very comfortable and clean.. Breakfast was exceptional in a delightful breakfast room. Staff were very friendly and in particular the reception staff were friendly, helpful and were a pleasure to chat with. If you are considering staying in the centre of Rome you will not find one as good as this. We know because we have have been there in the past and are speaking from experience. Transport into centre is convenient and easy and is covered by the 11 euro 3 day City pass. Advantage is that you see the side of Rome as lived by the locals. Don't miss this one !

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay! Does what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: prettydaizy
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from Rome.The hotel was very comfortable.We had rented a car as we wanted to be comfortable getting to and back from the hotel.We are used to travelling for some time to get to the city centre where we live so we kind of expected it after reading all the reviews.We would take the car to the main bus stop which the nice reception lady told us about ,took a day bus pass,park the car for free and then roam about Rome on the buses.We would come back late in the night to find the car and then drive back to the hotel. The tip about buying our own water bottles and shopping at Conad or Carrefour for the day's snacks was very good.We would have a lunch of takeway pizza or something similar and treat ourselves to a proper italian dinner most days.We also went to Tivoli on a day trip but don't go on a Monday as it is closed,as we found out! The breakfast was reasonable and what you would expect for the price.In all the hotel was more than what we expected for the price.Everyone was friendly and helpful not like the frightening people that some of the reviewers have suggested.Only thing was that the rooms were a bit chilly. Have a nice stay in GORGEOUS Rome!!!:))

Reviews.Title: “"THE BEST"”
Reviews.Author: EDWARDDON41
Reviews.Content: I have just come home from Rome after a few days away to this wonderful and magical city.we stayed at this hotel and i can honestly say that myself and my wife have never been treated more courteously and with such good humour.As of some of the reviews that said that staff were impolite or rude i totally disagree they helped us every step of the way.To the people who said it was too far away from the city centre all i can say is no matter where you stay in Rome you have to travel to see the sights so an extra twenty minutes is nothing but a chance to rest your feet.Before we travelled we googled the location of the hotel and decided to get a private transfer to the hotel because we didnt want the trouble to negotiate Rome at night,we managed to get one for 45 euro which we were told was cheap from Fiumicino airport so look around for a good price.The room we stayed in was spotless and the breakfast was ample so i dont know what some people expect but i was more than pleased with it.So in review this hotel is great value for money so dont get put off by fearmongering that its too far away as its cheap by public transport and im already looking forward to our return to this hotel as we're missing it already,thanks to everyone at aurora garden hotel for a wonderful time and making it so memorable.A big hello to Alex,naughty boy, working on the sugar mama for you"laugh out loud",

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Liiiisa
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel and the staff were absolutley lovely - each night when we returned to the hotel the man on reception asked us if we had enjoyed our day. There is a nice lounge area with a bar which we sat in every night to plan the next day. The only problem with this hotel is the location - to get to central Rome you have to take a bus from the main street (no 334) and metro ride (From Rebbiba) which took us around about an hour, however, the journey wasn't too bad. The bus does take quite a big detour through an estate so don't panic. If this hotel was closer it would be perfect, it's only (minor) issue is the distance from central Rome. I would definitly reccommend this hotel if you don't mind the commute. We found that the commute allowed us to see how the people of Rome really live - the locals were very helpful when we looked a little puzzled looking for a bus stop etc. There is a Lidl store across the main road where the bus stop is which is quite handy if you want to get some cheap drinks - we got a six pack of bottled water for 76 cents which saved us loads of money as the stands in Central Rome charge 3-4 Euros a bottle.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price, great service!”
Reviews.Author: Jarrrtsa
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the service of this hotel. It's located a bit far from the centre, but you can get there easily and cheap by bus or/and metro. However, it didn't bother because it takes time to get anywhere in Rome. But at our point of view, traveling is more than hotel and colosseum ;) We liked especially people around and in the hotel, the service was way beter than in centre, prices were cheaper and overall experience good. Hotel itself was modest, but we only stayed to sleep so it served us well. Wonderful old lady was truly friendly and lovely. Alex the receptionist helped us with everything soooo much (we took roadtrips to venice and florence) from car rental to hotel bookings! We definitely recommend this hotel to everyone who's travelling without kids and are looking for something more than faceless giant hotel. This was our first time in Italy, we didn't speak Italian but it didn't matter, we got new great friends, definitely perfect experiences and lots and lots of beautiful memories. We even picked up basics of the language with a little help from personell and local grocery stores clerk! We'll sure to head back there! Grazie e buona fortuna to all personell at Hotel Aurora Garden. Jari e Teija, Finland

Reviews.Title: “UNFRIENDLY, WEIRD AND UNSAFE”
Reviews.Author: ShanelleB
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for myself and my boyfriends first trip abroad. We chose this hotel based on good reviews, only to find out when we arrived in Rome that we had made a terrible choice, as it was costing us 30EURO each way per day to get to the city centre and back by taxi. Yes, we could have used buses, but they all seems to be backwards as in going completely the wrong way. Asked locals that understood English for directions to the Vatican City and other attractions, but they gave us the wrong directions and several people didn't even know what the Vatican City was, which I find very strange! Anyway, back to the hotel....... As we walked in it smelt of cigars and other unpleasant scents. The man on reception who happened to be the Hotel Manager, was very unwelcoming to me and my boyfriend, as spoke to us like we were dirt on his shoe. He checked us in, whilst on the phone to somebody, didn't sound business related either, so probably was a personal call. He was not proffesional at all. When we asked for info on attractions he was very vague and said "what do you want to go there for?" (at this point - we were talking about the Colleseum). He asked for our passports, which at that point we found strange. However, later on we found out that hoteliers to keep them for a few mins to get details. He had our passports for at least 45 mins, and when we asked for them back he was reluctant to give them to us. Finally, after an hour we got them back after many sly comments from the Manager and bad humour. He then made comments to me in front of my boyfriend saying i was Beautiful and he said i can have my passport back if I gave him a kiss on the cheek. (had this been anywhere else - i would have taken it as a joke and seen the funny side, but he was serious). We went out for dinner, then later returned to the hotel to find he was waiting outside for us and said " i was wondering what happened to you and what time you would be back". We both found this very strange. He was over-friendly, but weird too and his joked lacked humour and came across as sleezy. Went to hotel room, and cried my eyes out to my boyfriend because i felt unsafe, i wasnt sure if we would wake up the following morning. He seemed so dodgy, and the fact our door wouldnt lock made me feel very uneasy. The next day, without the manager seeing us, we checked out and went to another Hotel (which was very nice). We had such high expectations of this hotel, but it wasnt all its cracked up to be - as it is too far out from any attractions, no shops, hardly any - well not even 2 bus stops, and it is very misleading. Also, rooms were nicely decorated and had a balcony - but it was dirty, musty and the bed was dirty. We left this hotel very disappointed and underwhelmed. I actually couldnt believe what we had experienced on our first night of our first holiday together. This hotel ruined our whole trip. There is more i could say about this hotel, but i think i have said enough for now. If you want to know more please email me -------------- My advise to anyone staying in Rome, do not stay here or anywhere on the outskirts, stay near the city as it is far too expensive each day!!

Reviews.Title: “Aviod ....... Aviod ...... Bad bad terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Browniebay
Reviews.Content: Due to our ignorance, we selected this hotel for its price. However, we were not aware of its POOR location!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It is a trek to the hotel. It is situated in a suburb area and you want to AVIOD it at all costs!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The staff receiving us was a gentleman and he was obnoxious, unfriendly and pompous. He did not even congratulate us on being able to find our own way to the hotel. Mind you, some steps to get there were missed out; mainly, walking from the bus stop to the hotel. How to trek to the hotel?? Take the bus/ train to Stazione Termini. Take Metro B all the way to Ponte Mamoolo, then change to a bus 343 or 344. Get off at Niucolai (if you are find the stop), then walk for another 15 mins to the hotel. Total journey time - 2 hours. The rooms were too small and they didn't provide much amenities. No shampoo, just a small sachet of shower gel per person (???). And just generally RELUCTANT to help a guest get from the inconvenient location to the centre of ROME!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Just to give you an idea, imagine, a bed & breakfast but just cutting corners to make a few more cents off you. That feeling sucks right. So do you and I a favor and just AVIOD this hotel. It should just close down and not embarrass the magnificent city of ROME.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed to be so far out of the city”
Reviews.Author: agnimitra
Reviews.Content: This hotel is probably the furthest you can stay in Rome... good 20 mins bus ride after the last metro stop of Rebbebia! The hotel is right in the middle of a residential neighborhood, and if we would open our balcony door we'd be forced to watch the daily chores performed by the residents of the opposite building. Rooms were too small, and the air conditioning poor for Rome summer. There was only one old and cramped elevator which could hardly fit one passenger with their luggage. Breakfast was sumptuous. The garden patio and the lounge were well decorated and spacious - wish the rooms were same too. Not worth staying here if you are on a quick tour of Rome - you would waste good 2-3 hours commuting every day! The staff were friendly and spoke English.

Reviews.Title: “A really lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: TeyaBeele
Reviews.Content: Despite it being on the outskirts of Rome and a little out of the way (about an hours travel to get to Rome's center), we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Aurora Garden Hotel - a wonderful choice. The rooms were clean and tidy, the staff really friendly and helpful and public transport close and easily accepssible. Breakfast was satisfactory. One thing - bring a map. The hotel was nearly impossible to find in the beginning. Also, for easy travel around Rome, we'd recommend buying the BTI 3 day tourist ticket for 11 euros. Otherwise, we'd definitely recommend this hotel. Knowing that we'd have greatly appreciated this information on our first day, I'm providing the following: Directions to the Aurora Garden Hotel from Fiumicino Airport using public transport: Take the FR1 train to Tiburtina F.S. (8 euros for a one way adult's ticket). Then take the Metro B line to either Ponte Mammolo or Rebibbia. Catch bus 344 or 343 to Via Nicola Maria Nicolai (Via Nicolai). Walk up Via Nicolai and take the third left then first right. The hotel is on the right.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel an staf except of the craizy old woman”
Reviews.Author: alymba
Reviews.Content: the hotel is far away from the city but for us that wasn't a problem in 40-60 min you can arrive to the colosseum , the hotel was generaly o.k. not a 3 star more lake 1 or 2 star but it was clean quaiet and it had a big bed . the brefkast was o.k. for italy but the second day at the hotel something horrible happend : my boyfriend and I were haveing breafkast when a craizy old women camed to our table and started screaming , the woman was verrrrrrrrryyyyyyy craizy she strated saing that we took to much food and that she had do a lot of work to bring food to the place where they served breafkast , she was ridiquless and absurd she was veryyyyyyyyyyyyy old and scary and what she was seing wasn"t true . the holl moment was very embaresing and she was very rude , after se screamed she stood next to us to wach if we take any other food , it was awful she is the reason that I would never go back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful find!”
Reviews.Author: northernshar
Reviews.Content: Folks at the airport laughed at us when we told them where we were staying. "Too far out of the city". So my nephew and I were skeptical. But when we did arrive to the Aurora Garden we were very happy. The hotel staff was helpful and always smiling. It was just a couple of minutes walk to the bus. We loved being in a quiet residential neighborhood after being so busy all day. Also, Daniele and Alex recommended a couple of great places to eat that were in the area and close to walk to. We had an awesome time in Rome and would stay at the Aurora Garden again. Shar and Brian

Reviews.Title: “Aurora Garden Hotel, Rome”
Reviews.Author: JGandAl
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for anyone wishing to visit Rome on a budget. Yes, it is quite a way out of the city but we were very pleasantly surprised at how easy it is to get to and from the centre of Rome. Just a few minutes walk from the hotel is a little tobacco shop that sells bus tickets. You can buy a one day, three day or week long ticket. The three day one is 12 euro's. (you have to buy your tickets first then validate them in a machine on the bus) The bus stop is just another couple of minutes walk back to the main road. Bus No: 337 stops there around every 20 min and will take you to a little bus terminal in around 8/10 min. From there catch the No: 60 bus. This will take you right into the centre of Rome in around 40 min. On your return, just catch the same buses. We found there are plenty of well signposted bus stops in the city centre where you can catch the No: 60. As for the hotel itself; clean, comfortable rooms, nice bathrooms and very helpful staff. Our only grumble would be about the breakfast's served up in the basement dining room - they were dreadful to say the least! However, would we stay there again? Yes, absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly...”
Reviews.Author: titamou
Reviews.Content: ....but not at all a 4 star hotel. Breakfast was satisfying, helpfull staff. My average rating is bacause of the value of money. Wi-Fi Interent isnt free (as in all of Italy). Too expensive to be so far from the center of Rome and be carefull travellers!..free parking might mean park in an open yard

Reviews.Title: “Mr. and Mrs Anna and the staff are all worth it :-)”
Reviews.Author: helleElsinore
Reviews.Content: This hotel is after our oppinion living up to their ***. We will actually give it a star more because of the very nice service and allways helpfull staff including the owners. Nothing was to small or to big for them to handle. Allways smiling, capepabble too speak decent english, (whis we did´nt expercience generaly in Rome), eccept for mrs. Anna, who never the less enjoyed very much speaking to the guest with her charming personality and willingness to try to have conwersation anyhow. This was very funny and I learned a lot of Italian from her and are considering going back to school to learn more - all because of here. :-) The garden at the hotel is very beatefull and well kept by Mr. Anna who was taking care of it as if it was a baby :-) The room was okay and the bathroom allways clean. The cleaningstaff was very attended to every day check the room with new towels etc. and also helpfull when I had forgot my key without even asking her. A little minus was the breakfast. Everything you can expect was there. But toastbread and toastcheese, which cant melt on only toasted bread, was far from a nice italian cheese and bread which we ofcourse expected to get in Italy. The ham we just did´nt like. But there is a solution to efverything, and we just bought cheese and ham in the Lidl just down the road and brought it allong every morning. During night we kept it in the minibar at our room. So not a big problem and no one from the staff ever complain to that. A big minus is the distance to the center of Rome. Here we are agreeing with all the other comments to this hotel. We also spoke to one of the portiers about it, and he admitted they know it is a problem and have considered a shottlebus. We can only recomend them to make that happen. The area around the hotel is quiet and okay, but in august most of the restaurant is cloosed, becuase the italian are having their holiday at this time. This is a huge problem toogether with the distance to the center because you are stucked out there in the evening to eat at the same restaurant every night (La Mucca, which is an okay restaurant, but not that speciel so you want to eat there more than once.). Otherwise you have to stay in the center all day and evening because you just dont take the trip twice a day. To much value time will be wasted. We will recomend the owners of the hotel to try to work together with these restaurants so that not all of them are on vacation at the same time. So in a short way - the hotel is nice an living up to their stars and will be perfect for turist traveling in there own car. But for us in spite off all the nice people we will another time chose a hotel closer to the City center. The family have another ''' star hotel near Termini, and we think that could be a good choice. We are going back to Rome - thats for sure! :-)

Reviews.Title: “complete waste of time, not enjoyable at all!!!!”
Reviews.Author: joharvey
Reviews.Content: Ok, to start off witth its very far from rome centre, which kinda was a good thing because it was less busy and more peicefull, however this means you are far from everything! The staff were all nice and helpfull except one guy who didnt even know what an iron was ( oh they do not supply and iron so you will have creased clothes for the rest of your holiday) we were on our honeymoon and expected a nice comfy room, double bed, however we got a crap room with 2 beds pushed up to each other and another single bed! pointless!! the beds were hard, actually very very hard, and pillows were hard and uneven. i was dissapointed that they did not suplly a kettle with cups, for tea and coffee makin, as most original bed and breakfast supply that along with an iron!! the room was very dark and dindgy, not very romantic at all, wouldnt recomend to families as there is nothing for children to play with, they will be bored out of there minds, the local resturants are ok i guess but for some reason when i asked for no egg on my pizza it came with a raw egg smack bam in the middle! stupidity! Breakfastwas the worst, when i wake up i like a nice decent breaky even if it is tea and toast, but this was not the case. the bread was cheap bread and starting to mould, also it taste very sweet and yuk! they had cheese out, but the cheese packets you get on ur mcdonalds burger. they also has slice ham (dont get this?) they had sour yogurts, the crossants had sweet stuff in it, i prefer them savoury but u dont get a choice in the matter, they did have a coffee machine but never came out hot enough, u might as well have a cold coffee instead of using that thing. any way what im tryin to say is that the breakfast is the same every single day!!!! you get bored, tired and sick to death of the same thing, i would eat at 8am and then at 10am i eat a mcdonalds just cause i was starving and unsatisfied. food is very dear, we spent around 50 euros a night on our tea, and everyone is quite ignorant, not helpfull people. obviously the heat and the tiring sightseeing all day takes it out of you so go in the winter where the heat is barable, you will enjoy ur stay alot more. But see for yourself, you might be a different person and may enjoy it! good luck! oh do not get a taxi to the hotel cause this will cost over 60 euros!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not again!”
Reviews.Author: CynthiaHM
Reviews.Content: This has been one of the most uncomfortable experiences in my life. At first I had some mixed feelings because of the comments people left about this hotel.... but, to be honest, I definitely should have listened to the ones who were saying to look for another hotel. We chose this hotel because it was part of a package but... next time, we will pay a little more and stay in a better place. Here is why we didn't like this hotel: 1. The hotel doesn't have any sign... so, we spent like 1 hour looking for it. 2. It is wayyyyyy to far from the center. If we wanted to go to la Fontana di Trevi, we had to travel close to 2 hours (by bus and train)! 3. We stayed 7 nights and we were not able to sleep well because the wall are paper thin. Besides, we had some drunk neighbors who were screaming in the middle of the night (4am). 4. The shower and the carpet were never clean! In other words.... not again!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: InaF
Reviews.Content: After missing a flight, we had to stay for the rest of our holiday in Rome, since the return flight was leaving from Italy. Left with no accommodation, we relied on the comments of the members on tripadvisor and after careful consideration we decided to stay at Aurora Garden Hotel. Even if the hotel was far away from the city, the accommodation itself was one of the best. The staff was very polite and helpful. The price included breakfast. I would definitely recommend this hotel, if you are not looking for a luxurious hotel or something too close to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Just right....”
Reviews.Author: JoT2
Reviews.Content: Staff extremely friendly. Very quiet here and suited us as we were away for a break for just the two of us for my partners bday. Travel to centre of city probably took 40 minutes or so but was so easy to do. Bus to ponte mammolo (think thats right) then metro into town! Only 2 lines so hard to get lost. Bed slightly hard for my liking but I'm just being picky. We wanted somewhere to rest our heads and legs and this was perfect. Only main issue was the breakfast wasn't fantastic, when they say continental they mean it. Processed ham, cheese, yoghurt, toast, boiled egg. No fruit, no hot stuff and my partner found this difficult as the bread was like cheap bread in England.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable hotel with friendly and helpful receptionists”
Reviews.Author: lecturertom
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Rome generally. The hotel was fine and the receptionists were all very helpful. Alex is still there and single again! The hotel is a fair deal, but you need to know how to get there - 1. take the train to the central station (Termini), 2. then the metro to Rebibbia, 3. then, after crossing to the other side of the main road, ie to go towards the left, bus 343 or 344 to a stop called NIKOLAI (no one told us this initially), then 4. walk up Via Nikolai, take third left , first right and there it is (5 minutes' walk). When we arrived late in the evening we took the right bus in the wrong direction (without crossing over the road) and got worried... Food is pricey!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Quiet Hotel great if you like using public transport”
Reviews.Author: Salsagirl77
Reviews.Content: A really nice Hotel, a little out of the way but easy to reach centre of Rome using Buses and metro (takes about 45-60mins) Hotel staff, Daniele, Sammy and Alex to name 3 were very helpful and spoke excellent English there are maps and instructions on which buses etc to take. Buffet style breakfast supplied was adequate/ toast pastries, cooked meat cheese etc Hotel exceedingling clean and with pleasant bar area and nice outdoor seating areas Public transport is fairly inexpensive single journey, day , 3 day and weekly passes available from the nearby Tabbacchi To get to the hotel especially later at night a prearranged shuttle is essential we met a couple who had been ripped off for taxi fare. shuttles can be arranged with the tour operator eg Expedia or through the hotel. My daughter 10 enjoyed her stay in the hotel - upside quiet at night downside travel time

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: unforgiven9
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with family for a 60th birthday holiday. The receptionist when checking in was very helpful and accommodating and the barman Nicola was also. The rooms were clean and surprisingly spacious for a European City and all had a lovely little balcony. Don't worry about the hotel being out of the city centre as there are frequent buses very close to the hotel- the receptionist (don't remember his name) gave us a map and bus information and explained everything to us on arrival. The breakfast buffet was plentiful and the garden area was a lovely way to relax with a drink from the bar. Nearby, a restaurant called LA MUCCA however, we weren't very impressed with it and a few minutes up the road on the opposite side is a fantastic steakhouse (la gallo) although a bit hidden away. Buy a weekly bus ticket from the tabaccino near the hotel for 16 euros and you have unlimited use of buses and metros for 7 days. Unbeatable!!! The only downside for me about this hotel was the other receptionist (A guy with long, curly hair) who was so unhelpful. he really brings the rating down in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “has "+" and same "-"”
Reviews.Author: agrene
Reviews.Content: OK, hotel IS indeend quite far- and I dont even meen the distance in km (ok.3 km from Rebbibia Metro station) but it takes tame to get there from metro by bus because of the heavy traffic. FIrst time you arrive, you think it's a horrible to get it. BUT there are same other options (other buses) to get to the centre - the best is to ask the stuff, which was very helpfull! Anyway, on the 3rd day we commuted quite swiftly. And taking the lokal transport allows you to "be" with the locals and watch how they live. All the rest about hotel is good- clean, nice rooms with balcony ( take the upper level so that you dont hear the water from the shower coming down), fine people. Breakfast just the basic. Adventages are 3 :good local place to eat just a 300m far - a lot of local families and group of friends came there for evening eating- noisy, happy place you can eat outside 2: hotel is a good place to have a rest after a whole day of sightseeing - you can sit in a small but cosy garden, beds are very comfortable and the nights are quiet. 3: easy to reach by bus is a car rental ( about 10 min) and it is easy to came back to hotel from the trip outside Rome, cause it is close to the ring. We took the car there for tha last day, went to Tivioli and Castel Gandolfo and also had swim at the sea - and next day we returned the car at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth it”
Reviews.Author: AlineMelo
Reviews.Content: Mesmo tendo visto nas outras rewiews que o hotel seria longe do centro não imaginamos que seria tão longe. É preciso pegar um onibus (30 min) até a ultima estação do metro e depois mais uns 25 min de metro até o centro (coliseu). Até o ponto de onibus ainda é necessario andar 3 quadras. As ruas até o hotel são desertas. O transito nos horarios de pico transforma a viagem de ida e volta em 1h e 30 min. O quarto é grande e o serviço bom. Mas nao vale a pena a distancia e o stress de demorar para chegar ao hotel. Even tough I had read the other rewiews about the distance from downtown we didn´t realized it was SO far. It takes a bus drive (about 30 min) to the last subway station and then a subway ride (about 25 min) to downtown (coliseo). You have to walk 3 blocks to the bus stop and the streets near the hotel are desert. The traffic on rush hours make you spend 1h and a half on the journey to the hotel. The room is huge and the service good. But the distance makes it so not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “aurora garden”
Reviews.Author: brysie
Reviews.Content: after reading some of the other reviews, i was slightly disheartened that i had booked this hotel, however after arriving at the aurora garden, i was pleasantly surprised. hotel staff fab especially al, his english is excellent and he is so helpful and gives out great advice. and yes the hotel is a little outside of rome city centre, but to be honest after a long day site seeing in the hustle and bustle of rome, its like going back to a little oasis, i would definatley go back to the aurora gardens without a doubt!! cracking little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: fleaby369
Reviews.Content: after booking this hotel i was slightly worried by some of the reviews it got.i have to say i was very happily surprised.the hotel was clean and the staff very friendly,most of them spoke very good english,much better than my italian anyway! yes it is outside of rome centre but the buses are so regular that it really doesnt matter.it takes about 30 minutes and it was 1 euro for the bus all the way into rome and they run untill midnight so getting back was no problem either.i would strongly recommend the aurora garden to anyone wanting a cheap,clean and friendly place to stay whilst in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great "but"”
Reviews.Author: bigdon0
Reviews.Content: Good points. Four of us arrived and were greeted on arrival by Al on the desk. Great character made us welcome and at home. We had lots of advice from him during the stay and great,mainly humorous conversations. The hotel is what it says Basic,clean,and friendly staff. The breakfast is excellent and plenty of it if you like continental breakfast that is. The local restaurants are very good even better if you speak Italian. prices lower than Rome generally due to this being in a none tourist area. We would recommend the Relax Restuarant,found after a couple of tries at other eating houses,in the area great food excellent service and very reasonable. Not so good points Bit of trade discription here about the closeness to various Rome features. The hotel is way out on the ringroad and at least two bus rides and the metro to get into the centre. Or a taxi which will cost up to 50 euro. If you do get the bus or eventually the metro be very aware of pick pockets.We had two attemts at our party on the same day.One ont the bus and one on the metro. Over all we hasd a great time at the Aurora Garden Hotel.And so should you

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Is Very Good”
Reviews.Author: nutty1975
Reviews.Content: Upon reading the reviews i was beginning to regret booking the aurora Garden hotel, Okay it is a distance from the centre, But public transport is nothing short of exceptional, The hotel was very very nice, the staff very friendly and courtious who spke brilliant english and were only too happy to oblige with any requests. There are 3 restaurants nearby (5 minute walking distance) 2 of which were very nice The Bambu which is part of the local Gym but the waiters spoke brilliant english and the food was of a very good quality, and Relax where the staff speak no english and the menu is all in italian but the food was fabulous.The third is a fish restaurant but i didnt get to sample this as it was closed whilst we were there For anyone travelling here from Fiumicino Get the Train to Termini then the metro to Rebibbia then get either the (343, 344)bus i cant remember the stop but the Staff at the Metro Central are very helpful a 3 day pass for the bus & Metro is €13 which can be used as often as you like.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Go To This Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: mariskaBucharest
Reviews.Content: This hotel is far away from the center of Rome. I had a terrible experience in the night of New Year. None of the taxi drivers wanted to take us (except if we pay 150 euro!!) from the center to the hotel. We had to walk from the metro station, Rebbibia, about 2km to the hotel because the buses are not available after 11pm. Take care all of you this year!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not so bad - We enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: SFClark
Reviews.Content: We were really worried about staying at this hotel after the reviews on the website about it. True it is about 40mins - 1hour from centre of Rome but the jorney in buy metro or bus is straight forward and the hotel staff were great in helping us to find our way around (free map when we arrived) You can take a bus (343, 344) to the metro but you can also take the 337 bus to pugliese terminal and then the express 60 right into piazza venezia (this bus runs regularly) We bought a 3 day metro/bus pass for 11 Euro and it was well worth it. The room was small but clean, the bathroom had recently been done up and we had a balcony. Only a few shops nearby but an excellent restaurant nearby "RELAX" it was called had great pizza, was cheap and you really got a taste of Italian life - take your phrase book though, menu all in Italian but the waitress loved the fact we tried to speak Italian even if we got is wrong. Once at Ribibbia metro central Rome is only 20 mins away. It was tiring but a lot cheaper than staying in a hotel closer to the centre at this time of year. Thanks to all the staff who helped make it a memorable holiday. I will one day return to Rome and may even stay in the same hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very unhappy with our stay at Aurora Gardens”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the Aurora Gardens hotel was a very troublesome ordeal, having gotten into a taxi we listened to the taxi driver complain all the way there(30-40 mins in taxi) about how out of the way this hotel is and why didn't we go for somewhere in the centre - at that stage we were thinking the exact same thing. When we eventually arrived we were not greeted warmly as usually expected. We were shown to our very basic room. When you stay at Aurora Gardens, you are bascially smack in the middle of the suburbs. I think we missed out on the real Rome experience by being so far from the centre. Everyone tried to milk us for all that we were worth. Our own hotel, yes Aurora Gardens, charged us €120,000.00 for a tiny tear in a blanket from where an iron fell on it. We were told we owed this much by a very unfriendly member of the staff who worked the reception. We tried to contest the amount they were looking for as the blanket was worth €10.00 at the most. We had to say that all we had was €100.00 and they reluctantly accepted that. Usually while away you will always be taken advantage of by the locals and chancers such as the taxi drivers, but being robbed by the very hotel which we had chosen to stay with was more than we could bear. I would NEVER go back to Aurora Gardens, its out in the middle of no where, its extremely basic, the staff were rude at times and worst of all they tried and succeeded in ripping us off. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. This hotel is for Italian people on vacation and Italians only.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best of hotels”
Reviews.Author: Deb12_8
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for a few days with my sister. Like several of the other reviews on this site we too felt that the hotel was a long way out. The bus and metro ride are about an hour in total and are in fact pretty straightforward once you know where you are going. The return journey is tougher than the ride into the city and inevitably included a long wait for a bus at the bus station. However, the worst part was not really being able to venture into the city in the evening - the thought of repeating the journey twice in one day was exhausting. The hotel itself was basic but okay. Rooms were reasonable but all the staff (with the exception of one friendly gentleman who manned the reception at night) were incredibly rude. For example: requests for more milk in the breakfast lounge, access to the safe, or the reporting of a faulty hairdryer were met with scowls, raised eyebrows, huffing and puffing with impatience and tutting. Needless to say we did not tip! I would strongly recommend that anyone considering staying in this hotel pays a little more and instead chooses somewhere nearer to the city.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: jacqui_7
Reviews.Content: You certainly get what you pay for - rubbish! There was nothing nice about this hotel other than leaving it. The staff were very unfriendly and boring. Their english was not good. The rooms were appalling and the noises that we could here from both inside the hotel and outside were very disruptive - we could even here our next door neighbour using her toilet - how embarrassing!! As for the breakfast - the room was down in a cold dungeon type place with hard seats that you would sit on at school and the food was mainly croissants and sweet breads. The coffee which was out of a machine wasn't even warm -and oh the sad looking attendant didn't even greet you on arrival! We will definately NEVER be back even it was free.

Reviews.Title: “IT'S VERY FAR FROM METRO STATION!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel,because it's very far from the last metro station Rebbibia, about 2km, after the metro you have to take the bus which is going near to a very bad looking area at the border of the city!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel fine but too far from Rome centre”
Reviews.Author: GazzaP
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a three night stay at the Aurora Garden Rome. Despite some doubts about it's distance from central Rome we decided to give it a try (based on some of the positive reviews here). Although the Hotel is quite nice with a pleasant bar area and helpful staff it is just too far from central Rome. The travelling to and from central Rome was too much and became very tiring, taking away much of the enjoyment of the holiday. Unless you dont mind a combined bus and metro trip of around 1 hour each way then try to find somewhere a little closer to central Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome for a week during the New Years holiday in 2004-2005, and I found this hotel to be quite charming. My friends and I stayed on the ground floor. We had a very nice large patio with wroght iron patio furnature. Any time we asked for extra stuff like towels or bubble bath we were given it promptly. Also, the staff was wonderful to us and always greeted us by name. Our rooms were cleaned daily unless we felt it was not necessary. But the first review was correct about the food. There was a wonderful little shop just a few blocks away that served great snack food. The issue of transportation wasn't all that bad. True it is a 2 block walk to the bus stop, but the length of the ride wasn't disagreeable. The metro ride is another situation entirely. My friends and I spent the whole week seeing as much of Rome as possible and we rode the metro quite a bit. All in all I enjoyed my stay at this hotel very much. Just remember, it's not central Rome for a reason...it's cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, but far from Rome center”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed in the Aurora Garden over Christmas 2004. The rooms are spacious and the bathrooms new. Floors are all marble. Hotel concierges speak perfect English, and are very helpful and friendly. Free breakfast was delicious. The orange juice (arancia biondo) was the best we've ever had in our lives. However, the hotel is a bit far from Rome center. You need to take a bus to Rebibbia metro station--the combined bus/metro ride is an hour each way. Longer if you are misfortunate enough to ride back during rush hour. Make sure you know enough Italian to buy a Metro/bus ticket in case the hotel runs out of them. The combined metro/bus tickets that cost 1 euro expire 75 min after purchase. Recommend either the 3-day (biglietto turistico integrato) for 11 euros or the 1 week (carta integrata settimanale) ticket for 16 euros. Although the commute was hard (especially on Christmas Eve when all public transportation shuts down at 9pm), it was nice being in the Italian suburbs watching Italians picking oranges in their front yards and being away from the craziness, trash, graffitti and beggars of Rome. Also, strongly recommend pre-booking a shuttle bus to take you from/to the airport to the hotel. After comparing notes with others who stayed in downtown Rome--this recommendation goes for whereever you stay in Rome. Highly recommend ---------------------- their rates are the best I've found--50 euros (for all 4 of us) each way and they speak English.

Reviews.Title: “Aurora visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 day break to the Aurora Garden Hotel, Clearly the Rebbibia metro is not 5 minutes away as advertised, it is a 20 minute bus ride,(naughty)! However other than that there is not to much to complain about, when we were there the hotel appeared to have mainly italian guests, quite nice to get away from the usual, run of the mill oversized tourists.The staff were polite and helpful, most of them spoke perfect English. The Hotel is clean and adequate. Although not in a perfect location, we found the Bus trips quite enjoyable, it gave us an opportunity to see the locals going about their eveyday business which included teenagers giving up their bus seats for older people! The Hotel also arranged for a Taxi to take us back to the Airport at 5.30am they did a deal for half the price we were charged on the way in!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 14 days at the Garden. The rooms were confortable and a good price. The staff was excellent. It was within walking distance of several good restraunts. We enjoyed visiting on the patio each evening with other guests. We very much enjoyed meeting and getting to know the staff. We could travel by bus or the Metro to any location in Rome. We considered it part of the experience. We hope to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I must profess a love of the Italy, its food its people and its climes. With 3 other friends we ventured to Rome on a student budget, in high summer, intent on our own 'Hepburnesque' Roman Holiday.The Aurots Garden Inn is not for the bloated lazy tourist, in shorts and windbreaker, puffuy red face and a need for immediacy of provision of sites, food and service. It is for the young wild thing who truly embraces an adventure and a dalliance with a culture and way of life that different to their own.We were not rich, a few euros and a willingness and enthusiasm to use public transport were probably our only assests in finding the hotel. But if quality of life is about richness of experience our journey to Ribibbia and beyond left the cup overflowing. I conceede it was a very hot August day and you have to walk alot but that little hotel is a treasure and the surrounding area and people are pleasant. There you get a real Italian experience not the sterile commercialised concierge and taxi.The staff were freindly and put up with 4 excitable 20-21 year olds as well as giving my boyfriend who came down from Bologna a last min room for the night aat a good rate. The local food is lovely as well I recommend Rodeo Drive Resturant- an absolute treasure.

Reviews.Title: “Tourists - avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moderngypsy
Reviews.Content: February, 2004. We had booked ten days at the Aurora Garden. They did lie on the phone -- as they said that they were close to the Vatican. We had to stay one night as we had arranged to meet friends there but we cancelled the rest of the stay. After a 30 minute Metro ride to Ribibbia, we had to take a 25 minute taxi ride to get to the Hotel. A two hour round trip to and from downtown Rome and the Hotel is NO GOOD for tourists. The building itself is not bad but the walls are paper thin and one can hear TOO MUCH from the next bedroom. They should not be permitted to advertise falsely!

Reviews.Title: “unsuspecting tourist beware!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is NOT a five minute walk to the Rabbibia subway station! IT IS A LIE!! As they will tell you when you get there, you must take a 25 minute bus ride to the Rabbibia subway station. (If you run, you may get to the bus stop in 10-15 minutes. Then you have another 30 minutes or so in the subway. Ifyou add waiting time, your trip into town, to the Colosseo, for example) will take you well over an hour. We stayed there during a tremendous heat wave, and opted to take a complete loss on what we paid this hotel and move to a wonderfully situated hotel downtown. There is absolutely NOTHING to see or do anywhere near this hotel, and, while the hotel itself was adequate, they would never get away with their false advertising (saying they are a five minute walk from the subway and posing a map that makes it look as though the subway stop is right down the block) in the usa. the desk workers were defensive about all of this, as I think they get a lot of angry guests that fell into their trap. One guy just kind of smirked at me when I asked him how to get to the subway stop. He proceeded to show me a map with directions to the bus that takes you to the subway. I asked him if you can walk there. In reponse, he laughed and said "that would be quite a walk" As we found out, you can find EQUALLY PRICED HOTELS OR EVEN CHEAPER ONES RIGHT IN THE HEART OF THE CITY. DO NOT FALL FOR THIS TRAP! Even the taxi driver who took us from this hotel to our new one downtown said that this hotel is for people who have business in the neighborhood and not for tourists. DON'T DO IT, DON'T DO IT!!!
